body:
I'm happy to move this to `MapboxMapViewBuilder`, but could you suggest how / where you'd like to see that be instantiated?

As of right now according the Sample App's [`MainActivity onCreate()'](https://github.com/airbnb/AirMapView/blob/cc055292909e598dd4c74b6d65fad67e6f5179c9/sample/src/main/java/com/airbnb/airmapview/sample/MainActivity.java#L39-L55) there's 2 ways into the setup process (ie what creates `WebAirMapViewBuilder` or potentially a `MapboxMapViewBuilder`.)  
1. [DefaultAirMapViewBuilder](https://github.com/airbnb/AirMapView/blob/cc055292909e598dd4c74b6d65fad67e6f5179c9/sample/src/main/java/com/airbnb/airmapview/sample/MainActivity.java#L43)
2. [AirMap.initialiaze()](https://github.com/airbnb/AirMapView/blob/cc055292909e598dd4c74b6d65fad67e6f5179c9/sample/src/main/java/com/airbnb/airmapview/sample/MainActivity.java#L54)

Neither of these ways allows for external credentials to be passed in to the library so that the runtime determination on Google Plays Services can work (ie use Google Native if available, if not use Mapbox Web).  The only way around it would be to explicitly set an AirMapInterface via [AirMapView.initialize(FragmentManager fragmentManager, AirMapInterface mapInterface)](https://github.com/airbnb/AirMapView/blob/cc055292909e598dd4c74b6d65fad67e6f5179c9/library/src/main/java/com/airbnb/android/airmapview/AirMapView.java#L61-L74) which would then immediately load the Mapbox Web.

Thoughts?

body:
How about we require that the Mapbox token and app ID be included as [meta-data](http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/manifest/meta-data-element.html) in the `application` node of the `AndroidManifest.xml`. 

This aligns exactly with [the way Google Maps V2 works](https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/android/signup) (see the section titled `Add the API key to your application`).

you can just call parent here I believe.
we should try to implement this if possible.
i couldnt find it in the docs. @bleege do you know if mapbox supports this?
it is not implemented in `WebViewMapFragment`, only in `GoogleWebViewMapFragment`
@felipecsl You're referring to different maps like "Road, Satellite, Hybrid" correct?  If so, to get that to work for Mapbox a MapId with that style is needed.
Exactly. I couldn't find the correct method to call. Do you mind pointing me to the correct docs page, please?

my apologies. Did not realize. The china webview fragment behavior should be the same as the google one but with a different URL. So at the very least we should be able to copy the solution from the GoogleWebViewMapFragment here.
sounds good, I'll make them share the same code then!

@felipecsl Yep, Mapbox absolutely supports this feature.  It gets hidden a bit sometimes because MapType is a Google specific name / concept.  Anyway, to swap from Streets to Satellite to Terrain the MapId needs to be changed.  In this case changing the `id` field in [`L.mapbox.map`](https://www.mapbox.com/mapbox.js/api/v2.2.1/l-mapbox-map/) to a corresponding value will change the display.  So the Google to Mapbox conversion looks like:
- NORMAL == `mapbox.streets`
- SATELLITE == `mapbox.satellite`
- TERRAIN == `mapbox.outdoors`
@bleege I can't seem to find a way to make it work. `map.id = 'mapbox.sattelite'` has no effect.
@felipecsl I found a [better example](https://www.mapbox.com/mapbox.js/example/v1.0.0/toggle-baselayers/) of how to do this.  It actually involves swapping the `tileLayer` instead of the `id` field.

body: Minor point, but it should be `Mapbox` instead of `MapBox`.  :smile:
im not a big fan of this because it makes `AirMapMarker` mutable and makes it know about `Marker` but we can improve this in a future PR
any special reason why this was here?
`WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE` is not required anymore on Google Play Services 8.1?

Nope. Actually as of api 19 you can read and write from your own special
area of external storage without permission. But the permission was needed
for before 19. So as of 23 if your app isn't granted the permission it
still works fine.
On Sep 27, 2015 20:17, "Felipe Lima" notifications@github.com wrote:

> library/src/main/java/com/airbnb/android/airmapview/DefaultAirMapViewBuilder.java

> >    }
> > 
> >    private static boolean checkNativeMapSupported(Context context) {
> > -    return isGooglePlayServicesAvailable(context) && hasWriteExternalStoragePermission(context);
> > 
> > ## \-  }
> > -  private static boolean hasWriteExternalStoragePermission(Context context) {
> > -    return ContextCompat.checkSelfPermission(context,
> > -        Manifest.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) == PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED;
> > -    return isGooglePlayServicesAvailable(context);
> 
> WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is not required anymore on Google Play Services
> 8.1?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub

body:
deleted previous: But will update to do what docs say:

```
<uses-permission
        android:name="android.permission.WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE"
        android:maxSdkVersion="22" />
```

It looks like according to https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/android-api/config a future version will not need it at all.

body: you shouldn't change the `VERSION_NAME`. This should be always a SNAPSHOT release, since Travis auto uploads after every successful build of master. Just keep it 1.3.0-SNAPSHOT, we change it locally to 1.3.0 for the release and then update to 1.4.0-SNAPSHOT afterwards (and commit).

@@ -1,3 +1,6 @@
+# 1.1.6
+* Added setTouchEnabled() to enable/disable zoom, pan and drag
body: you can leave this part out -- we'll include it once we push an updated version to maven central, which may include additional changes

Just replace the if/else blocks with this:

``` javascript
map.setOptions({draggable: enabled, zoomControl: enabled, scrollwheel: enabled, disableDoubleClickZoom: !enabled});
```

Similar as above:

``` java
webView.loadUrl("javascript:setTouchEnabled(" + enabled + ");");
```
please don't use wildcard imports

we can clean up some duplicate code here. 
use the `id` to determine which type of `AirMapViewTypes` to use, so something like this: 

```
else if  (id == R.id.action_web_map_no_touch || id == R.id.action_native_map_no_touch) 
  AirMapViewTypes mapType = (id == R.id.action_web_map_no_touch) 
                      ? AirMapViewTypes.WEB : AirMapViewTypes.NATIVE; 
  airMapInterface = mapViewBuilder.builder(mapType)
                                .withOptions([construct view options with touch enabled/disabled])
                                .build(); 
```

that way we don't need to add the map loaded listener, and can get rid of the final references to the `AirMapInterface`

@petzel in the GoogleMapOptions class there isn't the same method `setAllGesturesEnabled` but there are `tiltGesturesEnabled, rotateGesturesEnabled, zoomGesturesEnabled, scrollGesturesEnabled`.

Do you prefer if we use the `setAllGuesturesEnabled` method, which means we have to set it on a OnMapLoadedListener or would you want me to set all of the above 4 methods?

Ideally we'd allow for full control of all of of these different methods - if you could add support for them that'd be cool, otherwise I'm fine with using `setAllGuesturesEnabled` for now, and I can add support for the others.

@petzel I'm having a little bit of trouble with using the options for the NATIVE type -- it won't accept an instance of `AirGoogleMapOptions` (it takes an `AirMapType`).

Therefore I proceeded to using the code below. However, the `OnMapLoadedListener` gets overridden by this activity's `onMapInitialized` method. Is there a way for me to overcome this? Thanks
should we instead place this setter into the builder, so we don't have to wait until initialization to set touch enabled/disabled?
@petzel the type `AirMapType` doesn't have access to the underlying map. Any ideas?

I feel like adding this functionality to the sample app in the menu isn't the best way to do it. We should probably create a separate configuration screen, from which users can tweak all of the available settings for any type of map. 

If you remove the changes from the sample app, it looks good to merge, then I can integrate it into the sample app in a separate configuration screen.

Setting the `myLocationEnabled` flag here on `NativeGoogleMapFragment` doesn't require location permissions. If anything I think this check should live on within `onLocationPermissionsGranted` here https://github.com/forrestbice/AirMapView/blob/30b6f1e28836e6c9e737cd41548b64b761b23035/library/src/main/java/com/airbnb/android/airmapview/NativeGoogleMapFragment.java#L270 but since the caller is responsible for calling `onLocationPermissionsGranted` it seemed fine to offload the responsibility of the permission check as well. Note: The `//noinspection MissingPermission` lint flag was already present within `onLocationPermissionsGranted`
